  "title": "Operations Manager",
  "description": "Ziba Consulting - Our client in the Upstream Oil and Gas sector is recruiting to fill the position&nbsp;below:

Job Position: Operations Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Department: Projects and Technology
Reports To: Operations Director

Position Summary


	Our client in the upstream Oil and Gas Company is seeking an experienced and results-driven Operations Manager to oversee multiple engineering projects and manage project-engineering teams.
	The ideal candidate will have over 10 years of relevant experience in the oil and gas industry, with strong leadership skills, extensive technical knowledge, and the ability to deliver projects on time, within scope, and within budget.
	This role will ensure project objectives are met while maintaining compliance with industry standards and company policies.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of multiple projects simultaneously.
	Develop project strategies, set goals, and define key performance indicators (KPIs) for project success.
	Supervise and mentor a team of Project Engineers, ensuring effective resource allocation and performance management.
	Foster a culture of collaboration, continuous improvement, and accountability within the project team.
	Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, budgets, resource allocation, and risk management strategies.
	Ensure adherence to project schedules, budgets, and quality standards.
	Identify project risks early and develop mitigation strategies.
	Manage project issues effectively, facilitating timely resolutions to maintain project momentum.
	Ensure projects comply with applicable codes, industry best practices, and company policies.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and ensuring project alignment with expectations.
	Represent the Company at client meetings, industry events, and stakeholder briefings.
	Oversee project budgets, manage financial risks, and ensure cost-effective resource utilization.
	Implement quality control procedures to maintain high standards of project deliverables.
	Provide required technical leadership on all engineering and field operations
	Oversee technical reviews and ensure engineering solutions meet project and client requirements.
	Manage relationships with vendors, contractors, and third-party consultants.
	Review contracts, ensure compliance with terms, and oversee procurement processes.
	Develop project performance frameworks, track key metrics, and report regularly to senior management.
	Conduct post-project evaluations to capture lessons learned and improve future project execution.
	Perform other responsibilities as assigned by senior management to support the organization&rsquo;s strategic goals.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in engineering (Petroleum, Geology or other related field)
	Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in the oil and gas industry, with at least 5 years in a project management role.
	Proven track record of successfully managing multiple complex projects in the oil and gas sector.
	Strong leadership, team management, and mentoring skills.
	In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies, budgeting, and scheduling.
	Strong knowledge of seismic data acquisition and processing techniques
	Proficient in design and project management software (e.g. MS Project, Primavera, AutoCAD).
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.
	Strong problem-solving abilities and decision-making skills.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
	Willingness to travel to project sites as needed.
	Professional certification in project management (PMP, PRINCE2) is highly desirable.
	Advanced degree (MBA or Master&#39;s in Engineering) is an advantage.
	Strong understanding of HSE regulations and industry best practices.


Work Location / Conditions:


	Office environment with frequent field/site visits.
	May require extended working hours to meet project deadlines.
	Ability to work under pressure in dynamic project environments.

Operations Manager Job at Ziba Consulting




        
    

        
        Ziba Consulting - Our client in the Upstream Oil and Gas sector is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Manager
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Department: Projects and Technology
Reports To: Operations Director

Position Summary
     

            
    




	Our client in the upstream Oil and Gas Company is seeking an experienced and results-driven Operations Manager to oversee multiple engineering projects and manage project-engineering teams.
	The ideal candidate will have over 10 years of relevant experience in the oil and gas industry, with strong leadership skills, extensive technical knowledge, and the ability to deliver projects on time, within scope, and within budget.
	This role will ensure project objectives are met while maintaining compliance with industry standards and company policies.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of multiple projects simultaneously.
	Develop project strategies, set goals, and define key performance indicators (KPIs) for project success.
	Supervise and mentor a team of Project Engineers, ensuring effective resource allocation and performance management.
	Foster a culture of collaboration, continuous improvement, and accountability within the project team.
	Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, budgets, resource allocation, and risk management strategies.
	Ensure adherence to project schedules, budgets, and quality standards.
	Identify project risks early and develop mitigation strategies.
	Manage project issues effectively, facilitating timely resolutions to maintain project momentum.
	Ensure projects comply with applicable codes, industry best practices, and company policies.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and ensuring project alignment with expectations.
	Represent the Company at client meetings, industry events, and stakeholder briefings.
	Oversee project budgets, manage financial risks, and ensure cost-effective resource utilization.
	Implement quality control procedures to maintain high standards of project deliverables.
	Provide required technical leadership on all engineering and field operations
	Oversee technical reviews and ensure engineering solutions meet project and client requirements.
	Manage relationships with vendors, contractors, and third-party consultants.
	Review contracts, ensure compliance with terms, and oversee procurement processes.
	Develop project performance frameworks, track key metrics, and report regularly to senior management.
	Conduct post-project evaluations to capture lessons learned and improve future project execution.
	Perform other responsibilities as assigned by senior management to support the organization’s strategic goals.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in engineering (Petroleum, Geology or other related field)
	Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in the oil and gas industry, with at least 5 years in a project management role.
	Proven track record of successfully managing multiple complex projects in the oil and gas sector.
	Strong leadership, team management, and mentoring skills.
	In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies, budgeting, and scheduling.
	Strong knowledge of seismic data acquisition and processing techniques
	Proficient in design and project management software (e.g. MS Project, Primavera, AutoCAD).
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.
	Strong problem-solving abilities and decision-making skills.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
	Willingness to travel to project sites as needed.
	Professional certification in project management (PMP, PRINCE2) is highly desirable.
	Advanced degree (MBA or Master's in Engineering) is an advantage.
	Strong understanding of HSE regulations and industry best practices.


Work Location / Conditions:


	Office environment with frequent field/site visits.
	May require extended working hours to meet project deadlines.
	Ability to work under pressure in dynamic project environments.

Senior Project Engineer Job at Barama Energy Resources




        
    

        
        Barama Energy Resources is committed to be among the world’s best global energy companies, most admired for its people, services, partnership and performance while adhering to the highest standards of business conduct.

We are dully approved and certified by the Nigerian Content Development & Monitoring Board (NCDMB) and Department of Petroleum Resources (DPR) in respect of in-country specifics for different project work. We also co-operate with complementary companies into forming high technology consortium related to the oil and gas activities and other energy projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Project Engineer
     

            
    



Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Manage projects from concept to completion, ensuring timely and within-budget delivery.
	Coordinate with cross-functional teams, including operations, sales, and customer representatives.
	Conduct site visits to monitor progress, identify potential issues, and implement solutions.
	Develop and manage project plans, schedules, and budgets.
	Ensure compliance with safety protocols, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Collaborate with clients to understand their needs and expectations.
	Provide technical guidance and support to junior engineers and technicians.
	Analyse project data to identify areas for improvement and optimize performance.


Requirements
Some Key Requirements include:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Petroleum, or related engineering field.
	Minimum 5+ years of experience in oilfield services, project management, or related field.
	Graduating grade of Second Class Upper (2:1) or higher
	Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
	Prior extensive experience in the oil and gas industry
	Strong knowledge of drilling, completion, and production operations.
	Proven project management skills, with experience in budgeting, scheduling, and cost control.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Professional engineering certification (PE) or equivalent.
	Experience with project management software and tools.
	Familiarity with industry standards and regulations (e.g., API, OSHA).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: careers@baramaenergy.ng using "Senior Project Engineer" as the subject of the mail.

Administrative Manager Job at Syx-Brij Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Syx-Brij Nigeria Limited - Our client, Lifeshade Hospital, located at 3, Osholigbehin Street, Behind Mobil Filling station, Off Awolowo Road, Oke Ota-ona, Ikorodu, Lagos, is a modern Hospital committed to providing exceptional healthcare services to the community.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Manager 

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	They are seeking highly motivated and skilled individuals to fill the position of an experienced Admin Manager to oversee the daily administrative and operational functions of our hospital.
	The successful candidate will ensure efficient workflow across all departments, provide strong leadership to administrative staff, and support hospital management in delivering quality healthcare services.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate the hospital’s administrative activities
	Manage staff rosters, attendance, performance tracking, and HR-related duties
	Assist in budgeting, financial monitoring, and resource allocation
	Coordinate communication between medical, nursing, and administrative teams
	Handle patient and client relations professionally, ensuring excellent service delivery
	Oversee facility operations, including procurement, supplies, and maintenance
	Ensure compliance with hospital policies, healthcare regulations, and government standards
	Maintain accurate documentation, patient records, and administrative reports
	Support senior management in strategic planning and execution


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Business Administration, Hospital Administration, Management, or related field
	Minimum of 2–5 years of proven experience in administrative or managerial roles (healthcare/hospital setting preferred)
	Strong leadership, organizational, and problem-solving skills
	Excellent written and verbal communication abilities
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities
	Knowledge of hospital operations and healthcare compliance is an added advantage.


What We Offer


	Competitive and timely salary package
	Growth-oriented and supportive work environment
	Opportunity to contribute to impactful healthcare delivery
	Professional development and training opportunities.
